subject: Travel
title: The Left Hand Taboo
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Left Hand Taboo.

hook.text: In much of Asia and the Middle East, handing someone food or a gift with your left hand is offensive.

buildup.text: The left hand is traditionally used for personal hygiene. It's seen as the 'unclean' hand.

discovery.text: In India, you eat, pass dishes, and greet people strictly with the right hand only.

twist.text: Left-handed people in some cultures were historically forced to switch. Some schools still enforce it.

climax.text: In Indonesia, pointing with the left hand or touching someone's head are both serious social errors.

punchline.text: Which hand you use says more than what you're holding.

quiz.question: Why is the left hand considered taboo in many cultures?
